scenarios.title: Corporate Burnout and Life Purpose

context.situation_background: Sarah has been working at a prestigious consulting firm for 5 years. She climbed the ladder quickly but now feels emotionally drained and questions whether this is what she truly wants to do with her life.
recent_events: Received a promotion with significant salary increase
Best friend left corporate world to start art therapy practice
Parents expressed pride in her success
Noticed she's been having trouble sleeping
client_concerns: Feeling ungrateful for complaining about success
Fear of disappointing family
Uncertainty about what would actually fulfill her
Financial security vs. personal happiness
hidden_factors: Deep creative side she's suppressed since college
Growing interest in helping others heal
Childhood dream of being a teacher
Fear of being seen as a failure

scenarios.primary_question: Everyone expects me to be grateful for my stable life, but I feel empty. Why?
followup_questions: Should I stay in my current job?
What would bring me more fulfillment?
How can I honor both security and happiness?
learning_objectives: Identifying core values and authentic desires

scenarios.title: Trust Issues After Betrayal

context.situation_background: Marcus discovered his partner of 3 years had been having an emotional affair with a coworker. They're trying to work through it in therapy, but Marcus struggles with rebuilding trust.
recent_events: Partner ended the emotional affair
Started couples counseling
Partner shared phone passwords
Marcus found himself checking up on partner constantly
client_concerns: Constant anxiety and suspicion
Feeling like he's becoming controlling
Uncertainty if love is enough
Fear of being hurt again
hidden_factors: Previous relationship ended due to infidelity
Struggles with self-worth
Difficulty expressing vulnerability
Pattern of pushing people away when hurt

scenarios.primary_question: Can I ever trust my partner again, or am I just setting myself up to be hurt?
followup_questions: How do I stop feeling so anxious all the time?
What do I need to heal?
Is this relationship worth saving?

scenarios.title: Empty Nest Syndrome

context.situation_background: Linda's youngest child just left for college. After 25 years of parenting being her primary identity, she feels lost and uncertain about who she is now.
recent_events: Youngest daughter moved to college dorm
Cleaned out daughter's room
Husband suggested they take a vacation
Old friend invited her to join book club
client_concerns: Feeling purposeless without children to care for
Marriage feels different after years of child-focused living
Doesn't remember what she enjoyed before kids
Worry about being seen as 'just a mom'
hidden_factors: Talented artist before having children
Always wanted to travel
Marriage has grown distant over the years
Pride in raising successful children

scenarios.primary_question: Now that my kids are grown, who am I supposed to be?
followup_questions: How can I rediscover myself?
What should I focus on now?
How do I reconnect with my husband?

scenarios.title: Career Pivot vs. Graduate School

context.situation_background: Alex works in marketing but feels called to become a therapist. They've been accepted to a graduate program in counseling psychology but would need to quit their job and take on significant debt.
recent_events: Accepted to competitive graduate program
Received unexpected work bonus
Friend warned about therapist burnout
Volunteered at crisis hotline and loved it
client_concerns: Financial burden of graduate school
Starting over at age 30
Family thinks they're making a mistake
Uncertainty about being good at therapy
hidden_factors: Deep desire to help others heal
Natural empathy and listening skills
Fear of financial instability
Imposter syndrome about intelligence

scenarios.primary_question: Should I leave my stable marketing job to pursue graduate school in therapy?
followup_questions: Am I being realistic about the challenges?
What would I regret more - trying or not trying?
How can I make this decision with confidence?
learning_objectives: Exploring fears around change and risk

scenarios.title: Loss of Faith After Tragedy

context.situation_background: David lost his teenage son in a car accident 8 months ago. Previously deeply religious, he now questions everything he believed about God, meaning, and whether life has any purpose.
recent_events: Son's birthday passed recently
Stopped attending church
Wife suggests grief counseling
Found son's journal with plans for the future
client_concerns: Feeling abandoned by God
Anger at religious platitudes from others
Marriage strain due to different grief styles
Questioning if son's life had meaning
hidden_factors: Deep fear that death is truly the end
Guilt about moments of feeling normal
Spiritual experiences that contradict his doubt
Son shared his spiritual questioning before death

scenarios.primary_question: How can I believe in anything good when such terrible things happen to innocent people?
followup_questions: Is my son at peace?
Will I ever feel whole again?
How do I honor his memory while moving forward?

scenarios.title: Debt and Self-Worth Spiral

context.situation_background: Maya graduated college with significant debt, works two jobs but still struggles financially. She's been using credit cards for basic necessities and feels overwhelmed by the mounting debt.
recent_events: Credit card was declined at grocery store
Saw friends posting vacation photos
Mom offered to help with money (pride says no)
Found a financial advisor willing to work with her
client_concerns: Feeling like a failure as an adult
Shame about needing help
Fear of never getting ahead
Comparison with more successful peers
hidden_factors: Excellent work ethic and problem-solving skills
Fear of being seen as a burden
Perfectionist tendencies that prevent asking for help
Strong values around financial independence

scenarios.primary_question: I feel like I'm drowning in debt. Does this mean I'm failing at life?
followup_questions: Should I accept help from my family?
How can I change my financial situation?
When will things get better?

scenarios.title: Chronic Illness and Identity

context.situation_background: Elena was diagnosed with an autoimmune condition two years ago that causes unpredictable flare-ups, forcing her to give up her dance career and adapt to a new reality of managing chronic pain.
recent_events: Had to cancel plans with friends due to flare-up
Doctor adjusted medication with mixed results
Saw former dance colleagues performing on social media
Partner has been incredibly supportive but Elena worries about being a burden
client_concerns: Feeling like a shadow of her former self
Guilt about partner having to adjust their life
Grief for the life and career she lost
Uncertainty about what brings meaning now
hidden_factors: Deep connection to movement and expression
Fear of being seen as weak or broken
Natural teaching abilities
Strong resilience that she doesn't recognize

scenarios.primary_question: How do I find purpose and joy when my body has betrayed me?
followup_questions: Will I ever feel whole again?
How can I contribute to the world now?
What does healing look like for me?
learning_objectives: Reframing concepts of strength and wholeness

scenarios.title: Creative Block and Perfectionism

context.situation_background: Jordan is a freelance graphic designer who hasn't produced personal art in months. They feel stuck, uninspired, and worried that their creative well has dried up permanently.
recent_events: Stared at blank canvas for hours without creating anything
Saw amazing work by other artists online
Client praised their commercial work
Found old sketchbooks from art school
client_concerns: Fear that they've lost their artistic voice
Comparison with other artists
Pressure to create something meaningful
Wondering if commercial work has dulled their creativity
hidden_factors: Perfectionist tendencies paralyzing their process
Need for play and experimentation
Disconnection from original artistic motivations
Fear of creating something 'bad'

scenarios.primary_question: Why can't I create anything meaningful anymore?
followup_questions: How do I reconnect with my creativity?
What's blocking my artistic flow?
Should I take a break from client work?

scenarios.title: Caring for Aging Parents

context.situation_background: Robert's father has early-stage dementia and his mother is struggling to care for him alone. Robert lives two hours away and feels torn between his own family responsibilities and caring for his parents.
recent_events: Mother called crying after father got lost driving
Family meeting about assisted living options
Robert's teenage daughter expressed feeling neglected
Father had a lucid moment asking Robert to 'take care of your mother'
client_concerns: Feeling pulled in too many directions
Guilt about not being able to do more
Fear of making wrong decisions for parents
Impact on his own family relationships
hidden_factors: Complicated relationship with demanding father
Mother's pride preventing acceptance of help
Financial strain of care options
Deep love despite family tensions

scenarios.primary_question: How do I balance caring for my aging parents with my responsibilities to my own family?
followup_questions: When is the right time to consider assisted living?
How do I handle my guilt about not doing enough?
What does my father really need from me?
learning_objectives: Processing guilt and grief around aging

scenarios.title: Recovery and Rebuilding Trust

context.situation_background: Sam has been sober for 8 months after struggling with alcohol addiction for years. They're working the steps but feeling overwhelmed by the damage done to relationships and self-worth during active addiction.
recent_events: Completed step 4 (moral inventory) with sponsor
Daughter agreed to limited phone calls
Attended former colleague's retirement party (sober)
Had intense cravings after stressful week at work
client_concerns: Fear of relapse during difficult emotions
Overwhelming shame about past actions
Impatience with slow progress in relationships
Questioning if they deserve forgiveness
hidden_factors: Strong commitment to recovery program
Natural leadership qualities emerging in sobriety
Deep capacity for empathy and connection
Fear that happiness might trigger complacency

scenarios.primary_question: How do I live with the wreckage of my past while building a future worth staying sober for?
followup_questions: Will my daughter ever trust me again?
How do I forgive myself?
What if I relapse?

scenarios.title: Coming Out Later in Life

context.situation_background: Taylor, married with two teenagers, has recently acknowledged they are transgender. They've been questioning their gender identity for months and finally understand why they've felt disconnected from themselves for so long.
recent_events: Started seeing a gender-affirming therapist
Tried presenting as their true gender privately
Spouse reacted with confusion and fear
Found supportive online community
client_concerns: Fear of losing family and marriage
Guilt about 'disrupting' everyone's life
Anxiety about workplace and community reactions
Questioning if they're too old to transition
hidden_factors: Lifetime of masking and performing expected gender role
Deep relief at finally understanding themselves
Strong relationship foundation with spouse despite current tension
Fear that authenticity equals selfishness

scenarios.primary_question: How do I honor my authentic self without destroying my family?
followup_questions: Is it too late to make such a big change?
How do I help my family understand?
What does living authentically really mean?

scenarios.title: Startup Struggles and Self-Doubt

context.situation_background: Priya left her corporate job six months ago to launch a sustainable fashion startup. Initial enthusiasm has given way to daily stress about money, competition, and whether her idea is viable.
recent_events: Pitched to investors with mixed results
Competitor launched similar product line
Received encouraging feedback from early customers
Bank account running dangerously low
client_concerns: Wondering if she made a huge mistake leaving security
Imposter syndrome about being a 'real' entrepreneur
Pressure to succeed quickly
Fear of admitting failure to family and friends
hidden_factors: Genuine passion for environmental impact
Strong business instincts and problem-solving skills
Perfectionist tendencies slowing decision-making
Support network that believes in her vision

scenarios.primary_question: Should I give up on my startup and go back to corporate safety?
followup_questions: How do I know if this is normal startup struggle or actual failure?
What would success really look like for me?
How long should I keep trying?
learning_objectives: Exploring definitions of success and failure
Timing and persistence in business decisions

scenarios.title: College Major Uncertainty

context.situation_background: Mia is a college sophomore who started as pre-med but finds herself more drawn to her psychology electives. She's considering changing majors but worries about disappointing her parents and starting over.
recent_events: Struggled with organic chemistry exam
Loved abnormal psychology class
Parents asked about MCAT prep timeline
Academic advisor suggested exploring options
client_concerns: Parents' investment in medical school dream
Time and money already spent on pre-med track
Uncertainty about psychology career prospects
Fear of making wrong choice
hidden_factors: Natural empathy and listening skills
Genuine interest in human behavior
Family pressure to pursue prestigious career
Strong academic performance in psych courses

scenarios.primary_question: Should I switch from pre-med to psychology?
followup_questions: How do I talk to my parents about this?
What career paths would make me happy?
Is it too late to change direction?
learning_objectives: Balancing family expectations with personal interests
Exploring career alignment with natural talents

scenarios.title: Retirement Hobbies and Purpose

context.situation_background: Frank recently retired after 35 years in accounting. He's financially secure and healthy, but feels restless and bored. His wife suggests he find hobbies, but nothing seems to stick.
recent_events: Tried woodworking class but felt clumsy
Joined book club but found it too social
Enjoyed helping neighbor fix his car
Wife signed them up for ballroom dancing
client_concerns: Feeling useless without work structure
Worry that he's become boring
Pressure to find meaningful activities
Fear that nothing will feel fulfilling
hidden_factors: Practical problem-solving skills
Enjoys helping others with technical issues
Prefers solo or small group activities
Values feeling competent and useful

scenarios.primary_question: How do I find activities that give me purpose in retirement?
followup_questions: What kinds of hobbies would suit my personality?
How do I stay engaged without feeling overwhelmed?
What does meaningful retirement look like?
learning_objectives: Supporting life transitions and new phases

scenarios.title: Making Friends as an Adult

context.situation_background: Casey moved to a new city for work six months ago and is struggling to make friends. They're introverted but lonely, and adult friendships feel much harder than they expected.
recent_events: Went to meetup group but felt awkward
Coworker invited them to happy hour
Joined gym and sees same people regularly
Video calls with old friends feel forced now
client_concerns: Feeling socially rusty after focusing on career
Worry about seeming desperate or needy
Comparing new city to comfort of old hometown
Questioning if they're too introverted for friendship
hidden_factors: Good listener and loyal friend qualities
Overthinking social interactions
Values deeper connections over surface chat
Actually making progress but not recognizing it

scenarios.primary_question: Why is making friends as an adult so hard for me?
followup_questions: What kind of friendships do I actually want?
How do I put myself out there without feeling fake?
Should I be more patient with the process?

scenarios.title: Building Healthy Morning Routine

context.situation_background: Nina wants to establish a better morning routine to start her days more intentionally. She currently rushes out the door and feels scattered, but previous attempts at change haven't stuck.
recent_events: Read article about successful people's morning routines
Tried waking up earlier but kept hitting snooze
Noticed she feels better on weekends with slower mornings
Friend recommended meditation app
client_concerns: Lack of willpower to stick with changes
Feeling overwhelmed by all the 'should do' advice
Worry that she's not disciplined enough
Time constraints with work schedule
hidden_factors: Actually does better with gentle, gradual changes
Values feeling calm and centered
Night owl tendencies working against morning goals
Perfectionist approach sabotaging progress

scenarios.primary_question: How can I create a morning routine that actually sticks?
followup_questions: What morning activities would serve me best?
Why do I keep failing at these changes?
Should I focus on evening routine instead?

scenarios.title: Solo Travel Anxiety

context.situation_background: Oscar has always wanted to travel but feels anxious about going alone. His friends are too busy or have different travel styles, but he's tired of waiting for the 'perfect' travel companion.
recent_events: Found great deal on trip to Ireland
Watched travel vlogs and felt inspired
Friend shared horror story about solo travel
Booking deadline is approaching
client_concerns: Safety concerns about traveling alone
Worry about being lonely or bored
Fear of looking awkward eating/sightseeing solo
Anxiety about navigating unfamiliar places
hidden_factors: Good planning and research skills
Actually enjoys his own company
Overthinking worst-case scenarios
Deep desire for adventure and independence

scenarios.primary_question: Should I book this solo trip to Ireland or wait for someone to go with?
followup_questions: How do I overcome my fears about solo travel?
What would help me feel more confident?
Is solo travel right for my personality?
learning_objectives: Distinguishing between reasonable caution and limiting anxiety

scenarios.title: First Apartment Decision

context.situation_background: Zoe is choosing her first solo apartment and torn between two options: a cheaper place with longer commute, or a more expensive but convenient location. Both have pros and cons.
recent_events: Toured both apartments with positive impressions
Calculated budget impact of each option
Current roommate situation becoming stressful
Parents offered financial help if needed
client_concerns: Worry about making financially irresponsible choice
Fear of regretting either decision
Pressure to be completely independent
Uncertainty about what factors matter most
hidden_factors: Values both financial security and convenience
Excited about living alone for first time
Good at budgeting and planning
Tendency to overthink simple decisions

scenarios.primary_question: Should I choose the cheaper apartment or pay more for convenience?
followup_questions: What factors should I prioritize in this decision?
How do I know if I can afford the expensive option?
Which choice will I be happier with long-term?

background.cultural_context: Working class, values honesty and hard work
First-generation college student, family values education
Traditional work ethic, values practical solutions
Values personal growth and new experiences
